event.title: 'Bay of Pigs' Invasion
Oswald moves to New Orleans

data.event: Oswald moves to New Orleans, and finds employment at the William B. Riley Coffee Company. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 320

event.title: General Walker shot

data.event: General Walker shot at in his home. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 319

event.title: Kennedy, Johnson, and Connally met

data.event: Decision for Texas trip made at meeting with Kennedy, Johnson, and Connally at the Cortez hotel in El Paso Texas. ref. W.C.

event.title: Veciana sees Maurice Bishop speaking to Oswald

data.event: Antonio Veciana travels to Dallas for a meeting with Maurice Bishop (A.K.A.David Atlee Philips). In the lobby of the Southland building, Veciana sees Bishop speaking to a man Veciana later identifies as Lee Harvey Oswald. ref. Last Investigation, p 141.

event.title: Reporter Arther Krock writes...

data.event: Reporter Arther Krock, citing a dispatch from Vietnam reporter Richard Starnes writes, "The CIA's growth was likened to a malignancy which the very high official was not sure even the White House could control any longer. If the United States ever experiences an attempt at a coup to overthrow the government it will come from the CIA and not the Pentagon. The agency represents a tremendous power and total unaccountability to anyone". ref. Last Investigation, p 422

event.title: Kennedy signs National Security Action Memorandum

data.event: Kennedy signs National Security Action Memorandum (NSAM) #263 signalling his intention to withdraw troops from Vietnam. ref. JFK, CIA, Vietnam by Prouty, p xxiii.

event.title: Oswald begins job at Texas School Book Depository

data.event: Oswald begins job at Texas School Book Depository. He reportedly obtained it through a contact of Ruth Paine. ref. Last Investigation, p 422.

event.title: Ruth Paine noted Oswald purchased rifle

data.event: Ruth Paine makes notation on her calendar 'LHO purchase of rifle.' ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 293

event.title: SS Agent Lawson receives schedule of Texas trip

data.event: SS Agent Winston Lawson is briefed and receives a tentative schedule of Texas trip from SS Agent Roy H Kellerman who was the agent in charge of arranging the timetable for trip and responsible for motorcade route.

event.title: Governor Connelly confirms trip

data.event: Governor Connelly confirms trip to Dallas on November 21--22/63. ref. W.C

event.title: Oswald writes to Mr. Hunt

data.event: Oswald writes to, "Dear Mr. Hunt, (Most likely Howard E. Hunt.) I would like more information concerning my position. I am asking only for information. I suggaestin that we discuss the matter fully before any steps are taken by me or anyone else. Thank you, Lee Harvey Oswald." ref. Last Investigation, p 423; ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 324; ref. Crossfire (Letter shown in full)

event.title: Oswald delivers note to Dallas FBI HQ

data.event: Oswald delivers a note to Dallas FBI HQ where Agent James Hosty is told to destroy it by Special Agent in Charge, Gordin Shanklin. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 261

event.title: SS Agents Lawson and Sorrels test-drive route

data.event: SS Agents Lawson and Sorrels drive route from Lovefield to Trademart which went down Main street to Stemmons freeway. ref. W.C.

event.title: Motorcade route reviewed, unchanged

data.event: Motorcade route reviewed but was unchanged. ref. W.C.

event.title: Dallas Times Herald reports motorcade route

data.event: Dallas Times Herald reported that the Presidential motorcade "apparently will loop through downtown area, probably on Main street on its way to Trade Mart". ref. W.C.

event.title: FBI teletype calls to determine potential threat

data.event: An FBI Teletype is received, directed to all field offices to contact CIs (confidential informants) to determine whether a revolutionary group was a potential threat to the president during his Dallas trip November 22 - 23. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 77

event.title: SS Agents Lawson and Sorrels verify motorcade timing

data.event: SS Agents Lawson and Sorrels with Dallas police assistant Chief Charles Batchelor drive motorcade route verifying that it could be driven in 45 minutes and was unchanged. ref. W.C.

event.title: Newspaper published precise route

data.event: Newspaper published precise route mentioning the turn into Elm into Houston then onto the freeway. ref. W.C.

event.title: Police officers witness mock target practice

data.event: Two Dallas Police Officers witness a "mock target practice" going on at the picket fence atop the knoll. They arrived in time to see the partipants depart in haste, and only write a report of the incedent subsequent to November 22. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 132

event.title: Newspaper reports motorcade route on front page

data.event: Newspaper reports motorcade route on front page. ref. W.C.

event.title: Rose Cheramie warns of JFK assassination

data.event: Rose Cheramie is thrown from a car, taken to hospital, and while there tells doctors that JFK is going to be killed in Dallas. ref. Crossfire, p 401.

event.title: Bundy signs key first draft of NSAM 273

data.event: McGeorge Bundy, then assistant to President Kennedy, signs the key first draft of NSAM 273, in contradiction to all previous Kennedy policy. ref. JFK, CIA Vietnam by Prouty, p xii.

event.title: Young man with rifle in bag spotted on Elm St.

data.event: Julia Ann Mercer, drives down Elm street, her way is blocked by a green Ford pickup truck. A young man removes a long paper bag, she can see the outlines of a rifle in the bag, and he walks with it to the top of the grassy knoll. She also sees the driver of the truck, whom she later identifies as Jack Ruby, (before he shot Oswald). ref. Crossfire, p 18.

event.title: Air Force One leaves Carswell AFB Fort Worth

data.event: Air Force One leaves Carswell AFB Fort Worth for 13 min flight to Lovefield Airport.

event.title: Motorcade leaves Lovefield Airport

data.event: Presidential Motorcade leaves Lovefield Airport. ref. W.C.

event.title: Oswald left alone in TSBD

data.event: Oswald is left on sixth floor of the TSBD as fellow workmates leave to go to Lunch break. He yells, "Guys, How about an elevator?" And then adding "Send one of the elevators back up". ref. Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p106

event.title: Oswald seen near telephone in TSBD

data.event: TSBD foreman Bill Shelley said he saw Oswald near the telephone on the first floor. Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p 107

event.title: Jack Ruby seen in office with Wanda Walker

data.event: Jack Ruby is seen sitting in an office at the Dallas Morning News by newspaper employee Wanda Walker. ref. Crossfire, p 327

event.title: Eddie Piper says he speaks to Oswald

data.event: TSBD employee Eddie Piper said he actually spoke to Oswald, "Just at twelve o'clock, down on the first floor".

event.title: Unidentified cars seen cruising motorcade area

data.event: Lee Bowers, a railway supervisor located in a tower behind the knoll fence, sees a 1959 Oldsmobile cruise the area. And at 12:20pm, a Black 1957 Ford also did the same and left. Then a third car, a 61 or 62 Chevrolet Impala entered the area, parked out of his sight near the decorative masonry wall, then reappeared immediately after the last shot. ref. Crossfire, p 75-76.

event.title: Oswald seen having lunch

data.event: Carolyn Arnold sees Oswald eating lunch on the second floor lunchroom. "Oswald was sitting in one of the booth seats on the right hand side of the room as you go in. He was alone as usual and appeared to be having lunch. I did not speak to him but I recognized him clearly." ref. Crossfire, p 49; Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p 108

event.title: TSBD sixth floor empty

data.event: TSBD employee Bonnie Ray Williams leaves the sixth floor after eating his lunch, he saw nobody ref. Crossfire, p 49; Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p 106

event.title: Man with rifle seen at Western end of TSBD

data.event: Witness Arnold Rowland observes man with rifle at the Westeren end of TSBD. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 300

event.title: Man with seizure in front of TSBD

data.event: A young man suffers some sort of seizure in front of the book depository. ref. Crossfire, p 42

event.title: Police radio for ambulance

data.event: Police Radio "code 3" (haste), for ambulance for Dealey Plaza. The ambulance arrived and picked up a suspected epilectic, departing at 12:25 pm, and was taken to Parkland Hospital where his admittance was never recorded. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 137

event.title: Bonnie Ray Williams left 6th floor

data.event: Bonnie Ray Williams, left the 6th floor after finishing his lunch and using the elevator joined co workers on the 5th floor to watch the motorcade. ref. Crossfire, p 47.

event.title: Kennedy shot

data.event: President Kennedy shot in Dallas.

event.title: David Ferrie takes mysterious drive

data.event: David Ferrie takes a mysterious 364 mile drive in the afternoon. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 131

event.title: Police radio

data.event: Police Radio. Bill Decker orders officers to the "Railroad track area just North of Elm." ref, Treachery in Dallas, p 136

event.title: Washington D.C.'s phone system breakdown

data.event: Breakdown of Washington D.C.'s telephone system for almost 1 hour. (Though Hoover's line remains fuctional?) ref. Conspiracy of Silence, p 71.

event.title: Oswald leaves TSBD and boards bus

data.event: Lee Harvey Oswald leaves Depository and boards bus. ref. W.C

event.title: Witness pinpoints window

data.event: Sergent Harkness reports he has a witness who had pinpointed the window. (Howard Brennan)

event.title: JFK arrives at Parkland Hospital

data.event: JFK arrives at Parkland Hospital. ref. Best Evidence, p 710.

event.title: White male seen running from TSBD

data.event: Police officer Roger Craig sees a white male running down the hill from the direction of the book depository and climbs into a waiting Rambler station wagon and drives off. ref. Crossfire, p. 329

event.title: Oswald gets off bus and boards taxi

data.event: Oswald gets off bus and boards second taxi after allowing a woman to take first taxi, talls driver William Whaley, "500 North Beckley Street". ref. WC

event.title: Description of suspect on police radio

data.event:
Description put out about suspect on Dallas police radio. "The wanted person in this is a slender white male about thirty, five feet ten, one sixty five, carrying what looked to be a 30.30 or some type of Winchester".
Officer Tippit told by H/Q dispatcher to "go to central Oakcliff area". ref. Rush to Judgement, p 194.

event.title: Police radio of assassin's location

data.event: Police Radio in refrence to the location of the assassin. "He is thought to be in the Texas School Book Depository here on the North West corner of Elm and Houston." ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 35

event.title: Capt Talbert orders to cut off TSBD

data.event: Capt Talbert giving orders on Police radio. "Have that cut off on the back side will you? Make sure nobody leaves there". (Refering to the Depository). ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 143

event.title: Homicide Chief William Fritz calls

data.event: Homicide Cheif William Fritz calls in to the dispatchers office from his post at the Trade Mart to ask if JFK will still be going to the site. He is told, "It's very doubtful." DOH! ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 150

event.title: Office Tippit calls H/Q

data.event: Officer Tippit calls into H/Q, and is asked if he is in Oakcliff area. He replies, "Yes". ref. Rush to Judgement, p.194.

event.title: JFK pronounced dead

data.event: JFK PRONOUNCED DEAD. ref. Best Evidence, p 710.

event.title: Police car outside Oswald's rooming house

data.event: Police car no 207 stops outside Oswalds rooming house, and sounds horn twice.

event.title: Bullet discovered

data.event: Parkland hospital. Darrell Tomlinson discovers the stretcher bullet 399 which rolls out from under a mat when stretcher bumps the wall. ref. Best Evidence, p 90.

event.title: Oswald seen entering Texas Theater

data.event: Oswald enters the Texas Theater according to theater assistant manager shortly after 1:00 pm. ref. Crossfire, p 353.

event.title: Oswald seen at bus stop

data.event: Oswald seen standing at bus stop outside his rooming house by his landlady. ref. Rush to Judgement, p 159.

event.title: Fake Secret Service agent pulled over

data.event: South of Dallas three men pulled over, one identifies himself as a Secret Service agent and states "We are in a hurry to get to New Orleans to investigate part of the shooting." However there is no record of Secret Service being dispatched to New Orleans on the day of the assassination.

event.title: Officer Tippitt calls H/Q twice

data.event: Officer Tippitt makes two attempts to call H/Q, but dispatcher does not reply. ref. Rush to Judgement, p 195.

event.title: J.D. Tippit's body discovered

data.event: T.F..Bewley comes upon J.D Tippit's body in the street. As he gets out to help he looks at his watch, which reads 1:10pm ref. Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p 122

event.title: Hulls found on sixth floor of TSBD

data.event: Policeman Luke Mooney finds hulls on sixth floor of Depository. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 143

event.title: Oswald inside Texas theatre

data.event: Oswald buys popcorn at concession stand inside Texas theatre, according to concession stand operator Boroughs. ref. Crossfire, p 353.

event.title: Police says Tippit shot

data.event: Police told "Officer Tippit has been shot." by civilian Domingo Benavides using Tippit's police car radio. ref. Crossfire, p 348.

event.title: Live TV reports shots heard from the Knoll

data.event: Jean Hill in live television report states she heard shots from the Knoll. ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 153

event.title: Rifle found on sixth floor of TSBD

data.event: Rifle found on sixth floor of Book Depository, first identified as 7.5 German Mauser.

event.title: Police radio describing Tippit's killer

data.event: Police radio call goes out describing Tippit's killer as about 30, 5ft 8in black hair and slender. ref. Unanswered Questions, p 105.

event.title: Police reports finding of white jacket

data.event: Police radio reports finding of a white jacket in parking lot. ref. Rush to Judgement, p 191.

event.title: Seth Kantor encounters Jack Ruby at Parkland hospital

data.event: Seth Kantor encounters Jack Ruby at Parkland hospital and has brief conversation with him. ref. Crossfire, p. 366.

event.title: TSBD declared secured

data.event: Police Radio. The TSBD is mentioned, "It's secure now." ref. Treachery in Dallas, p 143

event.title: Police radio from Tippit's murder scene

data.event: Police Radio from scene of Tippit's murder, "I got an eyeball witness to the getaway man - that suspect in this shooting. He is a white male ... apparently armed with a .32, dark finish automatic pistol..." ref. Conspiracy - Who Killed Kennedy?, p 119

event.title: Police radio of suspect entering Texas theatre

data.event: Police Radio "Have information, a suspect just went into Texas theatre on West Jefferson". ref. Unanswered Questions, p 112.
